etymologies: early 20th century: named after Pierre and Marie Curie

definitions: a unit of radioactivity, corresponding to 3.7 × 10¹⁰ disintegrations per second.
shortDefinitions: unit of radioactivity, corresponding to 3.7 × ¹⁰¹⁰ disintegrations per second

definitions: the quantity of radioactive substance that emits one curie of activity

examples.text: a curie of any radioactive element disintegrates at the same rate as 1 gram of natural radium

shortDefinitions: quantity of radioactive substance that emits one curie of activity
